page.title: 15Public school,Gerrards Cross
page.content: St Mary's,a public day school for girls aged 3-18 is situated in the old Gerrards Cross Manor House.It was founded in 1872 as a CofE School in Paddington,moving to this area in 1938. The school has 20 teachers and approx. 360 girls.There are 3 sittings at lunch time:Infants at 12.10;Juniors at 12.50; Seniors at 1.20.Everyone must have a school lunch,and every girl must wear th blue school uniform. There is a new assembly hall and gym and a heated open-air swimming pool.The music room is in the old house. On the wall of the main house is the coat of arms of Somerset.A former Lord of the Manor married a lady from that county.
